impyla.name: impyla
impyla.description: Python client for the Impala distributed query engine

repo.name: impyla
repo.description: Python DB API 2.0 client for Impala and Hive (HiveServer2 protocol)

readme.summary: Well-structured README with clear installation and basic usage, but lacks comprehensive configuration documentation and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: Configuration options (connection parameters, authentication mechanisms, cursor settings) are barely documented beyond a brief comment, and there's no troubleshooting section for common errors like connection failures or Kerberos issues.

common_complaints: Dependency version constraints blocking compatibility (thrift 0.16.0 pinned, bitarray <3.0)
SQLAlchemy 2.0 compatibility issues (dbapi() renamed to import_dbapi())
Connection and transport errors (TSocket, NoneType attribute errors)
SQL syntax handling limitations (single quote escaping issues)
sentiment.summary: The impyla project shows signs of abandonment with slow maintainer responsiveness, unresolved dependency compatibility issues blocking modern Python/SQLAlchemy adoption, and critical bugs remaining open for extended periods.

concerns: No closed issues in past 6 months despite 169 open issues
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
maintenance.summary: impyla appears to be abandoned with no maintenance activity for over 6 months and a large backlog of unresolved issues.

project_metrics.description: Python DB API 2.0 client for Impala and Hive (HiveServer2 protocol)

repo.name: arrow
repo.description: Apache Arrow is the universal columnar format and multi-language toolbox for fast data interchange and in-memory analytics

cves.summary: PyArrow: Arbitrary code execution when loading a malicious data file
Missing Initialization of Resource in Apache Arrow
Missing Initialization of Resource in Apache Arrow

Deserialization of untrusted data in IPC and Parquet readers in the Apache Arrow R package versions 4.0.0 through 16.1.0 allows arbitrary code execution. An application is vulnerable if it 
reads Arro

Deserialization of untrusted data in IPC and Parquet readers in PyArrow versions 0.14.0 to 14.0.0 allows arbitrary code execution. An application is vulnerable if it reads Arrow IPC, Feather or Parque

It was discovered that the C++ implementation (which underlies the R, Python and Ruby implementations) of Apache Arrow 0.14.0 to 0.14.1 had a uninitialized memory bug when building arrays with null va
While investigating UBSAN errors in https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5365 it was discovered Apache Arrow versions 0.12.0 to 0.14.1, left memory Array data uninitialized when reading RLE null data

repo.name: unified-memory-framework
repo.description: A library for constructing allocators and memory pools. It also contains broadly useful abstractions and utilities for memory management.
